Class StringUtil

java.lang.Object

public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object

A simple class that assists with String manipulation

beanify

public static java.lang.String beanify(java.lang.String str)
Convert the passed in string to a valid java method name. This basically capitalizes each word and removes all word delimiters.

Parameters:
str - The string to convert
Returns:
The converted string

debeanify

public static java.lang.String debeanify(java.lang.String str)
Convert the passed in bean style string to a underscore separated string. For example: someFieldName -> some_field_name

Parameters:
str - The string to convert
Returns:
The converted string

given a string, return the int of it; any parse error results in 0 being returned

Parameters:
s - the String to convert
Returns:
int the String converted to an int type

smartStringToInt

public static int smartStringToInt(java.lang.String s,
                                   int defaultValue)
given a string, return the int of it; any parse error results in default being returned

Parameters:
s - the String to convert
defaultValue - the default value to assign to the return value if the String didn't parse correctly
Returns:
int the String converted to an int type

replaceTags

public static java.lang.String replaceTags(java.lang.String source,
                                           java.util.Map params)
given a string and a map, all instances of {key} will be replaced with the value of 'key' in the map. so for example, "this is a {noun}" with a Map that has ("noun" => "fish") would produce "this is a fish"

Parameters:
source - the source string to be replaced
params - the parameters to fill out the source string with
Returns:
String Replaced String

stringToList

public static java.util.List stringToList(java.lang.String convertIn)
Using StringTokenizer, stringToList will convert the string to a list of individual strings based on the standard default StringTokenizer behavior. StringTokenizer
For example:

"AAA BBB CCC DDD EEE FFF"
would be converted to a list containing:
{"AAA", "BBB", "CCC", "DDD", "EEE", "FFF"}

Parameters:
convertIn - convert this string to a list
Returns:
List version of specified string

public static java.lang.String makeRandomPassword(int length)
Create a random password of the specified length

Parameters:
length - length of random password
Returns:
String new random password

htmlifyText

public static java.lang.String htmlifyText(java.lang.String convertIn)
Returns a String for html parsing escapes html converts \n to a break tag (<BR/<) converts urls beginning with http:// and https:// to links Example: given http://foo.bar/example return http://foo.bar/example

Parameters:
convertIn - the String we want to convert
Returns:
html version of the String
See Also:
org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtils

Join the strings contained in inputList with the separator. Returns null if the input list is empty

join

public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.String separator,
                                    java.util.Iterator itty)
Join the strings contained in an iterator with a separator. Used by join(String,List) and acts as a convenience for the few times we want to use join without a list.

Parameters:
separator - The String separator, use Localization.getInstance().getMessage("list delimiter") for the appropriate display separator.
itty - The iterator containing display items.
Returns:
The joined String

displayFileSize

public static java.lang.String displayFileSize(long bytes)
Converts the number of bytes to the appropriate unit (B, KB, or MB) depending on how many bytes there actually are. It then localizes the display of this number and formats the display with the units. It will return fractional units for larger numbers (123.45 Mb and 123.4 Kb)

Parameters:
bytes - the number of bytes used by a file
Returns:
A localized and formatted string displaying the file size

displayFileSize

public static java.lang.String displayFileSize(long bytes,
                                               boolean wholeNum)
Converts the number of bytes to the appropriate unit (B, KB, or MB) depending on how many bytes there actually are. It then localizes the display of this number and formats the display with the units. It will return fractional units for larger numbers (123.45 Mb and 123.4 Kb) unless wholeNum == true.

Parameters:
bytes - the number of bytes used by a file
wholeNum - should the result be returned as a whole number?
Returns:
A localized and formatted string displaying the file size

categorizeTime

public static java.lang.String categorizeTime(long target,
                                              int maxUnit,
                                              int minUnit)
Takes a target time (in msecs) and a maximum and minimum time-unit-of-interest and returns an I18N string in "x [maxUnits] y [units] ... z [minUnits] [ago:from now]" format.

Parameters:
target - timestamp in msecs-since-epoch of the event
maxUnit - constant representing the maximum unit you want to display.
minUnit - constant representing the minimum unit you want to display.
Returns:
I18N string in "x [maxUnits] y [units] ... z [minUnits] [ago:from now] format
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxUnit or minUnit not recognized, or if maxUnit < minUnit

categorizeTime

public static java.lang.String categorizeTime(long target,
                                              int maxUnit)
Takes a target time (in msecs) and a time-unit-of-interest and returns an I18N string in "x {units} {ago:from now}" format.

Parameters:
target - timestamp in msecs-since-epoch of the event
maxUnit - constant representing the unit you want to display. The code will "back off" from that to show the largest non-zero unit needed to represent the time-difference
Returns:
I18N string in "x {units} {ago:from now}" format
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxUnit not recognized

webToLinux

public static java.lang.String webToLinux(java.lang.String inWebStr)
Convert an incoming web-string (with \r\n EOL) to a Linux string (with \n as EOL)

Parameters:
inWebStr - string from a web form
Returns:
Linux-EOL'd-string TODO: This shoudl be generalized to handle other kinds of non-Linux EOLs, so we can use it on uploaded files as well

Encode a string for use in a URL.

Parameters:
source - Source string to encode.
Returns:
Encoded version of source.

toPlainText

public static java.lang.String toPlainText(java.lang.String html)
Basically turns an html or xml snippet to plain text Meant to be used along with string resources xml file messages. This is a best guess plain text conversion.. For example the following text 
 <p>You donot have enough entitlements for <strong>
                   xyz system </strong></p>
 will get converted to
 You donot have enough entitlements for xyz system
 It just returns the original snippet back in the case
 of an xml error (however it throws a warning)...
 @param html the html/xml String resources snippet to convert





Parameters:
html - html input

Returns:
the plain text version.

toJson

public static java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object obj)
Converts an object to json representation

Parameters:
obj - any object
Returns:
the jsoned representation

jsonToObject

public static java.lang.Object jsonToObject(java.lang.String json)
Converts a jsoned representation back to the object

Parameters:
json - json string
Returns:
the converted object.. The caller is expected to know the kind of returned object.

convertOptionsToMap

public static java.util.Map convertOptionsToMap(java.lang.String options,
                                                java.lang.String errorKey,
                                                java.lang.String separator)
                                         throws ValidatorException
Convert a string of options (name value pairs separated by '=', where the pairs are seperated by 'separator'), into a map.

Parameters:
options - the string of options
errorKey - the localization key of the error message to throw if we can't parse it correctly
separator - the separator the separates different name value pairs
Returns:
a map containing name value pairs of options
Throws:
ValidatorException - if there isn't an '=' sign seperating the pairs

convertMapToString

public static java.lang.String convertMapToString(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map,
                                                  java.lang.String seperator)
Convert a map of kernel options into a string: name1=value1 name2=value2 name3=value

Parameters:
map - the map of options
seperator - the seperator to seperate the pairs with
Returns:
the formatted string

addPath

public static java.lang.String addPath(java.lang.String originalPath,
                                       java.lang.String toAdd)
Add a path onto another path (either local path or networked service). This ensures double '/'s aren't included

Parameters:
originalPath - The start of the path (i.e. http://localhost/, or /var/www/)
toAdd - what to add (i.e. /pub/test.file)
Returns:
the full path with no duplicate '/'s
